item.title: What are meetings?
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: At work last week someone jokingly asked “What are meetings?”. The response was an instant classic: meetings are an institutionalized form of torture, common in large bureaucracies, organized by those who can’t code to inflict misery on those who can. As you might have guessed, we don’t have much in the way of formal meetings […]
item.content:encoded:
At work last week someone jokingly asked “What are meetings?”. The response was an instant classic:

meetings are an institutionalized form of torture, common in large bureaucracies, organized by those who can’t code to inflict misery on those who can.

As you might have guessed, we don’t have much in the way of formal meetings at Automattic.
